results.title: Roamin holiday
results.brief_description: Shot on a random bag of film stock and featuring footage of Inverloch, Marysville and Albury, this holiday footage is one of Frank Straford’s favourite ‘Highway rambles’. The title is a sly reference to the Hollywood film popular at the time.

results.title: Thirty years destroyed
results.brief_description: In this scripted drama, a mad scientist realises his life’s work - with deathly consequences. Borrows from classic horror movies of the period to irresistable effect.

results.title: Annual leave 1952
results.brief_description: The first filmed road trip to Eildon and Taggerty in their 1935 ‘Standard 10’ car shows the start of works on Lake Eildon to raise the level of storage.

results.title: Flash trip to the beach
results.brief_description: This home movie takes us back to an era when holidays seemed longer, days sunnier and road safety was much less of an issue. Older Bayside residents will be interested in scenes taken of Brighton streets and the Kinane Street beach. A man and a boy take a trip to the beach on the back of a motorbike.

results.title: Do you believe in ghosts?
results.brief_description: A young John Straford again stars in this editing exercise as a skeptic whose compusure is shaken by a very untoward event. The back garden sets the scene.

results.title: How to make a movie
results.brief_description: Although short and largely created to practise the Straford Brothers’ unique approach to editing and transitions, this already shows their ambitions for scene and story. Here, a frustrated filmmaker tries to make a ‘classic.’

results.title: Get in the picture at ACMI - Open House 25-7-04
results.brief_description: The results of July 2004’s Open House weekend program ‘In the Picture’ - a free taste of our popular Screen Adventures Program. Members of the public were invited to walk on and act up in front of ACMI’s blue screen ‘film genre’ sets.

group_siblings.title: The Very last thing from Pandora's Box

results.title: The Very last thing from Pandora's Box
results.brief_description:
Beautifully drawn and coloured animation ponders human existence - the misery and fleetingness of life and its solace, hope.
This work was produced as part of AIM (Centre for Animation and interactive Media), RMIT, 2003.
